_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Spartanburg Terminal was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes. It is the intent of the Spartanburg Terminal to incorporate the most recent procedural guidance (NFPA #58-2011, API 510, API 570) to the extent feasible. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Croft Fire Department as well as the Spartanburg County Office of Emergency Management (includes LEPC). Medical emergencies will require notification of the local emergency medical services ("Spartanburg EMS") and Spartanburg Regional Medical Center.  This facility trains its employees to respond to small or initial stages of an emergency.



The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Spartanburg Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping, one offload station and one butane storage vessel located on-site.



The facility's worst case scenario is the failure of the system's butane storage vessel when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% fill shut-off with alarm at 80%) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The facility's alternate (with potential off-site impact) release scenario is a "BLEVE" accident and associated fireball.



The Motiva Enterprises LLC - Spartanburg Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) inclusive of the 14 required elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the

manufacturer's (Sunoco Partners Butane Blending, LLC), instructions and recommendations.



To date, this facility has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place (new process).



In the event of an emergency involving the Motiva Enterprises LLC - Spartanburg Terminal's butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Croft Fire Department (Primary Response) and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the fire department and the Spartanburg County Office of Emergency Management. The Croft Fire Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Motiva Enterprises, LLC looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. Additionally, the Croft Fire Department will contact regarding participation in site emergency response drills. As this is a "new" system, there have been no accidents or incidents resulting in a significant release and subsequent death, injury, evacuation or sheltering-in-place.
